items.title: Trump taxes: Supreme Court says New York prosecutors can see records
items.content: However, the court rules that this information does not have to be shared with Congress.
items.contentSnippet: However, the court rules that this information does not have to be shared with Congress.

items.title: Xinjiang: US sanctions Chinese officials over 'abuse' of Muslims
items.content: China is accused of persecuting Uighur Muslims, including by locking them up in detention camps.
items.contentSnippet: China is accused of persecuting Uighur Muslims, including by locking them up in detention camps.

items.title: US Supreme Court rules half of Oklahoma is Native American land
items.content: The justices decide an eastern swathe of the state should be recognised as part of a reservation.
items.contentSnippet: The justices decide an eastern swathe of the state should be recognised as part of a reservation.

items.title: 'I can recover at home': Cosmetic surgeons see rise in patients amid pandemic
items.content: More people are having surgery as they can work from home while they recover and hide behind masks.
items.contentSnippet: More people are having surgery as they can work from home while they recover and hide behind masks.

items.title: Notre Dame: Cathedral's spire will be restored to 19th Century design
items.content: France's president puts an end to speculation that the restored spire will be modern in style.
items.contentSnippet: France's president puts an end to speculation that the restored spire will be modern in style.

items.title: Coronavirus: Idlib's first Covid-19 case raises fears for Syria camps
items.content: Aid groups say the first case is "a major blow" for huge numbers of refugees in north-west Syria.
items.contentSnippet: Aid groups say the first case is "a major blow" for huge numbers of refugees in north-west Syria.

items.title: Coronavirus: How Mexican cartels are taking advantage of pandemic
items.content: The BBC has secured exclusive access to one cartel trying to win over the hearts and minds of Mexico’s poor during the coronavirus pandemic.
items.contentSnippet: The BBC has secured exclusive access to one cartel trying to win over the hearts and minds of Mexico’s poor during the coronavirus pandemic.

items.title: Park Won-soon: Mayor of Seoul found dead after going missing
items.content: Park Won-soon disappeared after reportedly leaving a message for his daughter, who raised the alarm.
items.contentSnippet: Park Won-soon disappeared after reportedly leaving a message for his daughter, who raised the alarm.

items.title: Singapore election held against backdrop of pandemic and recession
items.content: Strict safety measures are in place, with voters concerned about the virus and a looming recession.
items.contentSnippet: Strict safety measures are in place, with voters concerned about the virus and a looming recession.

items.title: Sprinter's '200m world record' ruled 15m short
items.content: Noah Lyles briefly appeared to have set an astonishing new 200m world record - beating Usain Bolt's best by 0.29 seconds - before it was revealed he had run 15m short.
items.contentSnippet: Noah Lyles briefly appeared to have set an astonishing new 200m world record - beating Usain Bolt's best by 0.29 seconds - before it was revealed he had run 15m short.

items.title: Robert Fuller: Hanging death of black man ruled suicide
items.content: Robert Fuller's death sparked suspicion but investigators say he had history of mental illness.
items.contentSnippet: Robert Fuller's death sparked suspicion but investigators say he had history of mental illness.

items.title: Michael Cohen, Trump's ex-lawyer, ordered back to jail
items.content: He had been released from prison to home confinement over coronavirus concerns.
items.contentSnippet: He had been released from prison to home confinement over coronavirus concerns.

items.title: Naya Rivera: Glee star presumed dead after boat trip with son
items.content: Naya Rivera is believed to have drowned after her son was found alone in a boat on a California lake.
items.contentSnippet: Naya Rivera is believed to have drowned after her son was found alone in a boat on a California lake.

items.title: Egypt serial sex attacks prompt law change
items.content: It follows a high-profile case leading to charges of sexual assault against a wealthy male student.
items.contentSnippet: It follows a high-profile case leading to charges of sexual assault against a wealthy male student.

items.title: A dam on the Nile is making lots of heat but no power
items.content: Egypt sees the dam as an existential threat, while Ethiopia sees it as an existential necessity.
items.contentSnippet: Egypt sees the dam as an existential threat, while Ethiopia sees it as an existential necessity.

items.title: Coronavirus: The British-Pakistani doctors saving lives in both countries
items.content: From his laptop in Essex, Dr Tahir Akhtar is advising Pakistani doctors on treating coronavirus patients.
items.contentSnippet: From his laptop in Essex, Dr Tahir Akhtar is advising Pakistani doctors on treating coronavirus patients.

items.title: Coronavirus: How New Zealand went 'hard and early' to beat Covid-19
items.content: What has been the strategy behind New Zealand's Covid-19 success?
items.contentSnippet: What has been the strategy behind New Zealand's Covid-19 success?

items.title: US student visas: 'A lot of people I know are scared for the future'
items.content: The US said some visas could be revoked because of coronavirus, leaving students confused and uncertain.
items.contentSnippet: The US said some visas could be revoked because of coronavirus, leaving students confused and uncertain.

items.title: Black Lives Matter: From social media post to global movement
items.content: Black Lives Matter has sparked a hashtag, grass-roots organisations, and a collective of activists.
items.contentSnippet: Black Lives Matter has sparked a hashtag, grass-roots organisations, and a collective of activists.

items.title: Coronavirus: Is India the next global hotspot?
items.content: India's confirmed cases are going up rapidly, but it's not all bad news.

items.title: Coronavirus: The doctors on Yemen's front line
items.content: Five years of civil war have left the country's medical system devastated and Covid-19 is spreading largely unchecked.
items.contentSnippet: Five years of civil war have left the country's medical system devastated and Covid-19 is spreading largely unchecked.

items.title: Poland election: The fight for LGBT rights
items.content: President Andrzej Duda, who is accused of running on an anti-LGBT platform, is seeking re-election on Sunday.

items.title: How one woman's stolen identity exposed exam fraud

items.title: Black Lives Matter painted outside Trump Tower in New York

items.title: Coronavirus: The Australian community separated by lockdown

items.title: Tutankhamun’s last tour: Behind the mask

items.title: Coronavirus: Protesters and police clash outside Serbian parliament
